cards.html:
Friends:

This Election Day, I want to say thank you to our paying subscribers. You‚Äôve pitched in to fund something that corporate media refuses to do: real journalism that follows the money and holds corrupt politicians accountable.

As we await tonight‚Äôs results, I‚Äôd like you to take a look below at a breakdown of all the blockbuster reporting we produced this election season.

Among other things, our small-but-growing team exposed insurance companies purchasing favors from GOP Gov. Ron DeSantis in Florida, Wall Street bankrolling Senate candidate Ted Budd in North Carolina, and conservative activist Leonard Leo trying to buy the Iowa attorney general‚Äôs race. We also exposed the real estate industry trying to derail a proposed tax on mansions in Los Angeles, and spotlighted Democrats refusing to air ads on economic issues that might offend their corporate sponsors.

This kind of reporting is extremely expensive and labor-intensive. As a reader-supported independent media outlet, the only way we can do it is with your support. So thank you again for being part of our team. We can‚Äôt do this work without you.

Rock the boat,

Sirota

cards.calloutText: Please join us tonight: Starting at 8:00PM ET, we‚Äôll be video live streaming as election results come in. Not only will The Lever staff share real-time insights and reactions, but we‚Äôll be taking your calls directly, so you can be part of the conversation. Click here for event information!

cards.html:
Help us spread the word! Please forward this email to family and friends.

Was this email forwarded to you? Sign up for free to receive original reporting like this in your inbox every day.

sections: ul
The Democrat Who Picks Fights With Bad Guys
‚Äî Pennsylvania gubernatorial candidate Josh Shapiro is a Ted Lasso-style politician who does the one thing most Dems never do: He names the villains.
The Midterm Issue No One‚Äôs Talking About
‚Äî As voters push to prioritize climate change and fossil fuels spend big on key races, less than one percent of election ads are focused on the environment.
Corporate Power Is On The Ballot In Minnesota
‚Äî The attorney general race between Keith Ellison and Jim Schultz could shape consumer rights litigation across the country.
Low-Profile Arizona Elections Have Big Climate And Democracy Impacts
‚Äî A race for a little-known commission and an anti-dark money ballot initiative have huge stakes for the country and planet.
Leonard Leo‚Äôs Next Move
‚Äî The conservative activist‚Äôs new group is attacking Iowa‚Äôs Democratic attorney general for leading a consumer protection group.
In Climate Change-Ravaged Florida, Ron DeSantis‚Äô Insurance Giveaway
‚Äî The governor and his GOP colleagues quietly shielded their insurance donors from bad faith lawsuits ‚Äî at the cost of homeowners facing record levels of property damage.
Summer Lee Plans To Keep Fighting Forward
‚Äî David Sirota interviews Summer Lee, a progressive Democrat running for Congress in Pennsylvania, about the pro-Israel super PAC spending millions to stop her.
LEVER TIME: The Candidate Who Could Single-Handedly Save Democracy
‚Äî On this bonus episode of Lever Time: David Sirota interviews candidates Summer Lee and Josh Shapiro.
Wall Street Strikes Back
‚Äî This election season, the financial industry is proudly funneling cash and running misleading ads to boost its favorite political lackeys.
The Fed Chair‚Äôs November Surprise
‚Äî Jerome Powell is preparing to crash the economy days before the midterm elections, hurting workers and ushering his fellow Republicans into power.
Real Estate Industry Spends Big To Crush LA ‚ÄúMansion Tax‚Äù
‚Äî Corporate real estate interests, like Douglas Emmett, have come out in full force to try and defeat a ballot measure to hike taxes on multimillion-dollar property sales.
ELECTION INSIDER: Big Oil‚Äôs Midterm Meddling
‚Äî In five minutes, we‚Äôll tell you what you need to know about the low-profile ‚Äî but high-stakes ‚Äî races fossil fuel interests are trying to rig.
The ‚ÄúShoot Now Pay Later‚Äù Gun Financier Backing Nevada‚Äôs Adam Laxalt

‚Äî The GOP Senate candidate, Adam Laxalt, received maxed-out contributions from executives of a firm that runs controversial financing schemes with the gun manufacturer behind the Las Vegas, Nevada, and Uvalde, Texas, shootings.
LEVER TIME: Midterm Breakdown (w/ Chris Hayes)
‚Äî On this week‚Äôs Lever Time: David is joined by MSNBC‚Äôs Chris Hayes for a midterm deep-dive; and an extensive conversation about the power of persuasion.
Mastriano & PA GOP Plot War On Workers
‚Äî The GOP‚Äôs Pennsylvania gubernatorial nominee is planning to crush unions if he wins on November 8.
Budd Got Loans And Cash And Boosted Bank Merger ‚Äî Before Mass Layoffs
‚Äî North Carolina GOP Senate nominee Ted Budd helped clear the way for a controversial 2019 bank merger, then took hefty campaign cash and loans from the resulting financial behemoth.
LEVER TIME: Meet Wall Street‚Äôs Most Corrupt Senate Candidate
‚Äî On this week‚Äôs Lever Time: David and The Lever team expose a cartoonishly corrupt senate candidate; and dive deep into how bankruptcy laws are being exploited by corporations.
Deferring To Donors, Dems Ignore Their Cautionary Tale
‚Äî In 2014, the party learned pro-choice messaging can‚Äôt replace economic populism. That lesson is being ignored in deference to big money.
Ted Budd Aided Donors Trying To Bypass Predatory Lending Laws
‚Äî Documents show Ted Budd, the North Carolina GOP Senate candidate, pressed regulators to let his Wall Street donors get around predatory lending laws.
Dems Barely Messaging On Economic Issues
‚Äî Republicans are spending Democrats into the ground on economic issues and inflation.
Will Louisiana Finally Get Its First Black Senator?
‚Äî The Lever‚Äôs Sirota interviews Gary Chambers, a progressive Democrat running for a U.S. Senate seat in Louisiana.
A $21 Million Anti-Abortion Ad Blitz In Michigan
‚Äî Polls show strong support for a Michigan abortion-rights ballot measure as conservatives outspend pro-choice groups two to one.
Meet The Saudi Lobbyist Targeting John Fetterman
‚Äî A lobbyist-led super PAC just went on the air with attacks on Pennsylvania Senate candidate John Fetterman.
GOP Governors Raising Cash Off Migrant Abuse
‚Äî The Republican Governors Association ads ask: ‚ÄúWhere should GOP governors send Biden‚Äôs buses of illegal immigrants?‚Äù
LEVER TIME: Ron DeSantis‚Äô Worst Nightmare (w/ Charlie Crist)
‚Äî On Lever Time, we talk to the Democrat who polls show could defeat the Florida Republican governor in 2022.
ELECTION INSIDER: Who‚Äôs Buying The Midterms?
‚Äî In just five minutes, we‚Äôll tell you what you need to know about the biggest political donors this election season.
